New Records: The first walk-off grand slam in World Series history
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning to win the game for the Dodgers
Jazz Chisholm Jr. steals two bases and Volpe grounds him in for the lead in the 10th
Torres gets ahead in the count 2-1 and hits a deep drive, but a fan catches the ball for fan interference
Ohtani hits a line drive that just falls short of a game tying homer
Betts hits a scorcher to center - Judge makes the catch, Ohtani tags up to score, tie game
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman expressed his emotions after hitting the walk-off grand slam, saying 'That's the stuff when your five years old in the back yard, that's a dream come true.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game went into extra innings, with the Dodgers ultimately winning in the 10th inning
The Yankees' ace, Gerrit Cole, delivered a great performance, throwing 6 innings with 1 run, 0 walks, and 4 strikeouts
